textos_fuente.text: GOLF 352-522-0309 HOME GOLF REAL ESTATE DINING EVENTS Social Book A Tee Time More HOME GOLF REAL ESTATE DINING EVENTS Social Book A Tee Time 352-522-0309 HOME GOLF REAL ESTATE DINING EVENTS Social Book A Tee Time A Hidden Gem Tucked away about 10 miles outside the rolling hills of Ocala, FL, Juliette Falls is often called a "hidden gem", thanks to its exclusive location and the pristine condition of our course. The property was handpicked by our owner, who envisioned a course that would offer a fun yet challenging game for golfers of all skill levels, making it an experience unlike any other and a must visit destination. With the expertise of our Superintendent, Steve Keller, who has been with us since we opened in 2007, and the dedication of our amazing staff, Juliette Falls continues to be ranked in recognitions such as the Top 10 Courses in the Nation and Top 3 in Florida year after year! Book Your Tee Time Proud to announce that Juliette Falls is "Best of Florida Golf Courses 2025" by The Guide to Florida Thank you for voting! Explore our Course Hole 9 Hole 13 Hole 18 Hole 9 Hole 5 Hole 16 What Sets Us Apart Drainage Our course is renowned for its exceptional drainage, staying playable no matter the weather. Thanks to our pure sand-based property, we experience zero restrictions after rain events, ensuring the course remains firm and fast. We’ve never had to close due to flooding, not even after those famous Florida hurricanes! terrain Unlike much of Florida’s typically flat landscape, Juliette Falls boasts significant elevation changes throughout the course, creating a distinctive challenge for golfers. Notable holes like 8, 12, 13, and 15 feature dramatic rises and falls that add both beauty and strategy to the game. We began with a naturally rolling piece of land, and our course design was carefully crafted to highlight the unique topography of the property. Rather than flattening the landscape, we incorporated its natural features into the design to provide golfers with a dynamic and scenic experience. This thoughtful integration ensures that every round feels fresh and exciting, with each hole offering something special. Maintenance At Juliette Falls, we take great pride in our summer aerification process, which plays a key role in keeping our course in pristine condition. We perform three rounds of aerification each summer, once in June, July, and August, over the course of just four days each month. Because our dedicated crew works tirelessly to complete the job efficiently and effectively this process is completed in just 4 days each time. During aerification, we perform deep punching, rolling, and thatching to improve air circulation, water absorption, and root growth, all while maintaining fast and firm playing conditions. This rigorous process ensures that our course remains in excellent shape, even through Florida’s humid summer months, and ready for play every day. About Juliette Falls Course Flyover Course Flyover Course Flyover Course Guide Course Flyover Course Flyover Scorecard Course Flyover Recognition Recognition Golf Packages Recognition Golf Packages Golf Packages Golf Packages Play & Stay Golf Packages Golf Packages Superintendent's Blog Superintendent's Blog Superintendent's Blog Lessons Superintendent's Blog Superintendent's Blog FAQ's Superintendent's Blog FAQ's meet our team Ron Clapper Steve Keller Steve Keller COURSE OWNER Ron has always had a passion for golf & dreamed of owning his own golf course some day. That dream came to fruition in 2006 when he hand-picked our plot of land from an airplane flying over Ocala. He has been hands on ever since from development phase to every day operations ....Read More Steve Keller Steve Keller Steve Keller SUPERINTENDENT Steve has been with us since the day we opened, almost 20 years ago. No one knows this place better than him . Born with a passion for golf & raised in Michigan. He has been in the business for over 50 years now starting out hand-picking range balls, to the "master of turf" as we like to call him ...Read More read my blog Caylyn Milam Steve Keller Caylyn Milam DIRECTOR OF CLUBHOUSE OPERATIONS Caylyn has been a dedicated member of the Juliette Falls team for over 12 years. She began her career at the club in an entry-level role while finishing her Bachelor’s degree in business. Through hard work, determination and a passion for hospitality, she steadily rose to her current position as Director of Clubhouse Operations. ...Read More golf shop Check out our Golf Shop Visit Our Golf Shop & Gear Up in Style! Our golf shop has everything you need, from stylish apparel and logo balls to gloves and accessories. With bright, fun styles for both ladies & men , you’ll find something to fit your taste. We proudly carry top brands you'll love. Juliette Falls merchandise makes for great presents! Follow us on social media to stay up to date on sales, specials, and exclusive offers. Need a Gift Card? Call us today to purchase one! Top Golf Courses Near Ocala, FL - Book Your Tee Time! 352-522-0309 HOME GOLF REAL ESTATE DINING EVENTS Social Book A Tee Time More HOME GOLF REAL ESTATE DINING EVENTS Social Book A Tee Time 352-522-0309 HOME GOLF REAL ESTATE DINING EVENTS Social Book A Tee Time Top-Ranked Golf Course In a state with over 2,000 golf courses, Juliette Falls ranks among the very finest! In fact, we’ve been named year after year, as one of the best courses you can play in Florida. When you start with a great piece of rolling land, a world-class course architect, and a nothing less than perfection mentality, you can expect exceptional results! Book Your Tee Time Proud to announce that Juliette Falls is "Best of Florida Golf Courses 2025" by The Guide to Florida Thank you for voting! Real estate Juliette Homes At Juliette Falls, we don’t just sell homes, we sell a "lifestyle" ! Our community is rapidly growing with multiple builders constructing homes ranging in size from 1,400 sq. ft. to over 2,500+ sq. ft. & ranging in price from the mid $300's to $1M. learn more dining Restaurant at Juliette Falls Our restaurant & bar are open to the public every day, offering a wide range of options from homemade soups, great appetizers, delicious sandwiches & fresh salads. We serve dinner every Friday night with a unique menu every week curated by our culinary team. Don't miss our famous Prime Rib Night, 1st Friday of every month. learn more Events Host your Event with Us! We host a large variety of golf groups, fundraising tournaments & other private events here at Juliette Falls. Plan your next event with us! learn more blue bar The Blue Bar Stop in the blue bar, also known as the "19th hole" after your round and cool off with for an ice-cold beer or our signature "Gator Crush" cocktail! learn more Give the Gift of Golf E-gift cards can be purchased over the phone & e-mailed right to you! They can be used for a round of golf, golf shop merchandise or food & beverage. Joining Hired in January 2017 as its third Executive Director, she is responsible for leading the strategy and operations of this multifaceted workforce development organization that serves people across the Twin Cities. Julie has spent the last 25 years of her career in the nonprofit sector working to expand opportunities and access for those who have barriers to building a stable, hopeful future. Her passion for people, partnerships and collaboration drives her work in the sector. Her previous leadership at Project for Pride in Living focused on growth in fundraising, supportive housing, workforce development, support services, youth development, and more. She has a B.A. from University of Minnesota, has been a Georgetown New Strategies Fellow and Humphrey Policy Fellow, and has participated in both Leadership Twin Cities and the Target Foundation Nonprofit Leadership Program. Lilian Ngungkpan Director, Human Resources Lillian has 15 years of professional experience in HR, and is joining us following nearly 4 years of leadership at Rise, Inc. in Fridley. She previously held HR positions at Project for Pride in Living, Meridian Behavioral Health, NorthPoint, and many other organizations. She holds an MA in Human Resource Management from Saint Mary’s University of MN, and a BBA in Management from African Methodist Episcopal University, as well as a variety of certificates and certifications.. Debbie Ferry Director,         Employment Services Debbie currently oversees Hired’s Dislocated Worker, Adult WIOA and SNAP E&T Programs at Hired, including both programmatic and budget matters. Previous to Hired, Debbie worked at Avivo as their Vice President of Employment Services. She is an accomplished leader with over 20 years of experience in delivering financial and operational results. She has multi-unit management experience with proven ability in achieving corporate objectives. Debbie has a B.A. in Retail of Textiles and Clothing from Michigan State University. Rachel Grosskurth Director, Youth Programs With over 20 years of experience working with young people, Rachel has recently taken lead of Hired’s Youth Programs. Since 2007 Rachel has worked in numerous project areas within Hired’s youth team, receiving promotions from employment counselor to manager, then to director in January 2021. She has extensive experience in youth probation, corrections, and treatment, and deep knowledge of the juvenile justice system, expungement, and youth employment. She is passionate about fighting racial and social injustices in our community, and serves as a Racial Justice Facilitator at YWCA Minneapolis. Rachel holds an Offender Workforce Development Specialist (OWDS) Certification and is a licensed Global Career Development Facilitator (GCDF). She graduated from Metropolitan State University with a B.S. in Criminal Justice; her M.A. from Alfred Adler Graduate School is in School Counseling and Guidance. Rob Novak Chief Financial Officer Rob is a proven leader coupled with a strong analytical and results-oriented approach. Joining Hired in early 2020 as the new Chief Financial Officer, Rob is responsible for managing all aspects of Accounting and Finance, IT systems, and a variety of operation functions. Rob brings 25 years of experience, with a career that started in public accounting then transitioned most recently to the nonprofit sector. He has an extensive background in financial accounting, budgeting, operational improvements and managing teams. Rob is passionate about helping Hired find efficiencies and working closely with our leaders to meet strategic goals. Rob has a B.S in Accounting from St. Cloud State University and maintains an active CPA license. Andrea Peterson Director,                    Career Pathways With nearly 17 years of experience in career pathway development within Hired and the broader community, Andrea has worked with hundreds of participants over multiple roles over her career, from program delivery to strategic implementation and program management. Most recently, she served as Hired’s Senior Program Manager for Career Pathways, and Andrea has overseen significant program growth, expanding pathways to meet employer and participant needs. She is a proven, caring, and compassionate leader who cultivates a team dedicated to delivering high-quality programs in a supportive environment. Andrea holds a B.S. in Family Social Science from the University of Minnesota. Mayko Sadler Associate Director, MFIP Programs Mayko is a results-driven leader with over 12 years of management experience and 25+ years working with low-income, refugee and immigrant families. Her strategic eye and heartfelt commitment to the families we serve continue to result in successful outcomes for our participants. She is a dedicated leader with great expertise in Minnesota’s Family Investment Program, and now serves as Hired’s Associate Program Director to our public assistance programs as well as special initiatives in both Hennepin and Ramsey Counties. Mayko’s extensive knowledge and passion for delivering culturally aware and equitable services will continue to positively impact the communities we serve. Mayko holds an impressive background in education and training focused on equity leadership, human services, domestic violence, mental health, and motivational coaching with a GCDF certification. Jen Swalboski Director,                                                                       MFIP Programs Jen brings more than 10 years of experience in social services, workforce development, and supporting families receiving public assistance to stabilize and build a strong future through employment.  Jen’s career with Hired started as an employment counselor in 2014, and quickly, her strong leadership skills elevated her to a program manager in 2016. Jen is a graduate of the Twin Cities Leadership 2021-2022 cohort, is trained as a Motivational Interviewing Coach, a Domestic Violence Specialist, and Offender Workforce Development Specialist. Jen carries many valuable experiences and perspectives as director of Hired’s largest program. She holds a B.A. in Sociology from University of Minnesota Duluth, and a M.A. in Sociology from Utah State University. Deanna Threadgill Advancement Director Deanna is responsible for leading fundraising and communication efforts at Hired.  She has worked within the nonprofit community for more than 25 years in fundraising; communications; grants; and program development/management. Before joining Hired nearly 3 years ago, she was vice president for programs at Big Brothers Big Sisters Twin Cities, Deanna’s career has included work in higher education; workforce, economic and microenterprise development, and youth services.  She has served on national and local boards in mentoring, fundraising, grants, and youth protection and child safety She holds an M.A. in Philanthropy and Development from Saint Mary’s University of Minnesota, and a B.A. from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
